title: Egypt's Qalaa Holdings to increase production capacity to 5.5 mln tons per year
text:
Qalaa Holdings Chairman Ahmed Heikal is seen at Qalaa's section at the Egypt Economic Development Conference (EEDC) in Sharm el-Sheikh, in the South Sinai governorate, south of Cairo, March 14, 2015. REUTERS/Amr Abdallah Dalsh

CAIRO (Reuters) - Egypt’s Qalaa Holdings, one of the country’s largest investment companies, will operate 100% of its refinery units in January and increase its refinery production capacity to 5.5 million tons per year, the company’s chairman told Reuters.

Ahmed Heikal also said the company will offer shares of Taqa Arabia and Arab Refining Co in Q2 and Q4 2020 on the stock market, without giving details of the quantity of shares to be sold.
description: Egypt's Qalaa Holdings, one of the country's largest investment companies, will operate 100% of its refinery units in January and increase its refinery production capacity to 5.5 million tons per year, the company's chairman told Reuters.
